_comments._editing_guide: The fields below can be edited to customize the department page content. These texts will appear on the public website.
_comments._introText: Short introduction that appears at the top of the department page
_comments._descriptionText: Detailed description - you can use placeholder variables like {jurisdiction.name}, {department.name}, etc.
_comments._roleText: Description of the department's role and importance to the province
_comments._programsHeading: Heading for the programs and services section
_comments._programsDescription: Description of what programs and services this department offers

introText: The Ministry of Health is responsible for Ontario's healthcare system, ensuring accessible, high-quality medical care and public health services for all Ontarians across the province.
descriptionText: The Ontario Ministry of Health spent $82.9B in fiscal year (FY) 2023-24, representing 40.1% of the $206.6B in total provincial spending. This substantial investment ensures Ontarians have access to hospitals, physicians, public health programs, and essential medical services.
roleText: As Ontario's largest ministry by spending, Health plays the most critical role in the province's operations. It manages the healthcare system that serves 15 million Ontarians, oversees hospitals and health networks, administers OHIP, and coordinates public health responses including emergency preparedness.
programsDescription: The Ministry of Health operates Ontario's comprehensive healthcare system including hospital funding, physician services through OHIP, public health programs, mental health and addictions services, long-term care oversight, cancer treatment, home care services, and digital health initiatives.
